Utilize your non-dominant hand for tasks that require fine motor skills, such as writing, drawing, or typing.
Practice using your non-dominant hand for everyday activities to build muscle memory and increase dexterity.

Adapt your living and working environment to minimize the need for using your dominant hand, such as using one-handed tools or devices.
